keyMoments.title: Decides on Viking Funeral for Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Luffy makes the difficult decision to give the Going Merry a proper Viking funeral rather than let her sink alone to the ocean floor.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's growth as a captain and his deep emotional connection to the ship. This decision shows maturity and respect for their vessel.
keyMoments.quote: The seabed is dark and lonely. So we'll watch you to the end.

keyMoments.title: Tearful Apology to Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Luffy breaks down in tears and apologizes to the Going Merry for being rough owners and for not being able to fix the ship.
keyMoments.significance: One of the rare moments where Luffy openly cries, showing his profound emotional depth and capacity for grief. This vulnerability demonstrates character development.
keyMoments.quote: I'm sorry we were such bad owners. I'm sorry we couldn't fix you.

keyMoments.title: Klabautermann Confirmed
keyMoments.description: Franky confirms that what Usopp saw in Skypiea was the Going Merry's Klabautermann, validating Usopp's earlier experience.
keyMoments.significance: Validates Usopp's earlier encounter with the ship spirit and confirms he wasn't imagining things. This connects back to a pivotal moment in the Skypiea arc.

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Merry's Final Words
keyMoments.description: Usopp, who cared for the ship more than anyone, hears the Going Merry's final words of gratitude and apology while maintaining his Sogeking disguise.
keyMoments.significance: As the crew member most attached to the ship, this moment is particularly devastating for Usopp. His maintaining the Sogeking persona shows his pride even in grief.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Hearing Merry's Voice
keyMoments.description: Iceburg explains that he heard the Going Merry's spirit on Scrap Island asking to sail one more time, prompting him to repair the ship for its final voyage.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial explanation for how the Going Merry arrived at Enies Lobby and confirms the existence of the ship's spirit. This revelation adds weight to the supernatural elements of the ship.
keyMoments.quote: I want to sail one more time.

reveals.information: Can hear the voice of ships (the Klabautermann)

keyMoments.title: Explains the Klabautermann Legend
keyMoments.description: Franky explains to the crew the legend of the Klabautermann, a ship spirit that manifests when a vessel has been truly loved by its crew.
keyMoments.significance: As a shipwright, Franky provides the professional and mythological context for understanding the Going Merry's spirit. This establishes important world-building about ships in One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: A Klabautermann is a legendary manifestation of a ship's spirit that appears when a ship has been loved and cared for deeply by its crew.

reveals.information: Knowledgeable about the Klabautermann ship spirit legend
